org.tinfour.demo.viewer.backplane

Interface IModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModelAdapter, ModelFromLas, ModelFromShapefile, ModelFromText, UnitSquareModel

    public interface IModel
    Defines methods for accessing and maintaining a collection of sample points (a "model" of a surface).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addConstraints(File constraintsFile, List<org.tinfour.common.IConstraint> constraints)
      Adds constraints to the model
      boolean areConstraintsLoaded()
      Indicates if the constraint source for the model has been loaded
      boolean areVerticesLoaded()
      Indicates if the vertex source for the model has been loaded
      void geo2xy(double latitude, double longitude, double[] xy)
      If defined, converts a pair of geographic (latitude,longitude) coordinates to a pair of scaled Cartesian coordinates.
      double getArea()
      Gets the overall area of the model, in the units squared associated with the horizontal coordinate system.
      List<org.tinfour.common.IConstraint> getConstraints()
      Gets the current list of constraints for the model/
      org.tinfour.utils.loaders.ICoordinateTransform getCoordinateTransform()
      Gets the coordinate transform associated with the model.
      String getDescription()
      Gets a shortdescription of the model
      File getFile()
      Gets the file associated with the model
      String getFormattedCoordinates(double x, double y)
      Get a string representation for the specified model coordinates.
      String getFormattedX(double x)
      Get a string representation of the specified model X coordinate.
      String getFormattedY(double y)
      Get a string representation of the specified model X coordinate.
      org.tinfour.utils.LinearUnits getLinearUnits()
      Gets the linear units for the coordinate system used by the data.
      double getMaxX()
      Gets the maximum x coordinate in the sample
      double getMaxY()
      Gets the maximum y coordinate in the sample
      double getMaxZ()
      Gets the maximum z coordinate in the sample
      double getMinX()
      Gets the minimum x coordinate in the sample
      double getMinY()
      Gets the minimum y coordinate in the sample
      double getMinZ()
      Gets the minimum z coordinate in the sample
      String getName()
      Get the name or identification associated with the model.
      double getNominalPointSpacing()
      Gets the estimated nominal point spacing for the model
      List<org.tinfour.common.Vertex> getPerimeterVertices()
      Gets a list of the vertices that lie on the perimeter of the TIN.
      double getReferenceReductionFactor()
      Gets the reduction factor for the reference TIN
      org.tinfour.common.IIncrementalTin getReferenceTin()
      Gets the "reference" TIN that was created when the data was first loaded.
      long getTimeToLoadInMillis()
      Gets the time required to load the model, in milliseconds.
      long getTimeToSortInMillis()
      Gets the time required to perform the post-loading Hilbert sort on the vertices, in milliseconds.
      int getVertexCount()
      Get the number of samples in the model
      org.tinfour.common.Vertex getVertexForIndex(int index)
      Get the vertex with the specified vertex index.
      List<org.tinfour.common.Vertex> getVertexList()
      Gets the list of vertices currently stored in the model; for efficiency purposes, this is simply a reference to internal storage and not a safe copy.
      boolean hasConstraints()
      Indicates whether the model has constraints and is thus a Constrained Delaunay Triangulation (CDT).
      boolean hasConstraintsSource()
      Indicates that the model has a definition for a constraint source.
      boolean hasVertexSource()
      Indicates that the model has a definition for a vertex source.
      boolean isCoordinateSystemGeographic()
      Indicates whether the coordinates used by this instance are geographic in nature.
      boolean isLoaded()
      Indicates whether the content of the model was already loaded.
      void load(org.tinfour.common.IMonitorWithCancellation monitor)
      Load the metadata and data associated with the file for this model and compile a list of vertices for access by the application.
      void xy2geo(double x, double y, double[] geo)
      If defined, converts a pair of scaled Cartesian coordinates to a latitude and longitude.

    • Method Detail

      • getVertexCount

        int getVertexCount()
        Get the number of samples in the model
        Returns:
        a positive integer.

      • getMaxX

        double getMaxX()
        Gets the maximum x coordinate in the sample
        Returns:
        a valid floating point value

      • getMinX

        double getMinX()
        Gets the minimum x coordinate in the sample
        Returns:
        a valid floating point value

      • getMaxY

        double getMaxY()
        Gets the maximum y coordinate in the sample
        Returns:
        a valid floating point value

      • getMinY

        double getMinY()
        Gets the minimum y coordinate in the sample
        Returns:
        a valid floating point value

      • getMaxZ

        double getMaxZ()
        Gets the maximum z coordinate in the sample
        Returns:
        a valid floating point value

      • getMinZ

        double getMinZ()
        Gets the minimum z coordinate in the sample
        Returns:
        a valid floating point value

      • getNominalPointSpacing

        double getNominalPointSpacing()
        Gets the estimated nominal point spacing for the model
        Returns:
        a positive value in the units associated with the horizontal coordinate system.

      • getArea

        double getArea()
        Gets the overall area of the model, in the units squared associated with the horizontal coordinate system.
        Returns:
        a positive real value

      • load

        void load(org.tinfour.common.IMonitorWithCancellation monitor)
   throws IOException
        Load the metadata and data associated with the file for this model and compile a list of vertices for access by the application.
        Parameters:
        monitor - an optional monitor for tracking progress (null if not used)
        Throws:
        IOException - If a non-recoverable IO condition is encountered when reading the source file.

      • getFile

        File getFile()
        Gets the file associated with the model
        Returns:
        a valid file

      • getName

        String getName()
        Get the name or identification associated with the model. For file-based models, this value is usually the name (not path) of the file.
        Returns:
        a valid, potentially empty string.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Gets a shortdescription of the model
        Returns:
        a valid string.

      • getVertexList

        List<org.tinfour.common.Vertex> getVertexList()
        Gets the list of vertices currently stored in the model; for efficiency purposes, this is simply a reference to internal storage and not a safe copy.
        Returns:
        a valid list (empty if not properly loaded)

      • getFormattedCoordinates

        String getFormattedCoordinates(double x,
                               double y)
        Get a string representation for the specified model coordinates. Some models may include special information about formatting coordinates (such as those that implement geographic coordinates).
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate in the model coordinate system
        y - the y coordinate in the model coordinate system
        Returns:
        a valid string (content left to the implementation).

      • getFormattedX

        String getFormattedX(double x)
        Get a string representation of the specified model X coordinate. Some models may include special information about formatting coordinates based on their magnitude or if they represent geographic coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate in the model coordinate system.
        Returns:
        a valid string (content left to the implementation)/

      • getFormattedY

        String getFormattedY(double y)
        Get a string representation of the specified model X coordinate. Some models may include special information about formatting coordinates based on their magnitude or if they represent geographic coordinates.
        Parameters:
        y - the y coordinate in the model coordinate system.
        Returns:
        a valid string (content left to the implementation)/

      • isLoaded

        boolean isLoaded()
        Indicates whether the content of the model was already loaded. Typically this call is used for file-based models to indicate that data was read from disk.
        Returns:
        true if the model is loaded, otherwise false.

      • getReferenceTin

        org.tinfour.common.IIncrementalTin getReferenceTin()
        Gets the "reference" TIN that was created when the data was first loaded. It is expected that application code will access this TIN on a read-only basis and will not modify it. They are, however, allowed to replace it when a more detailed TIN becomes available.
        Returns:
        a valid TIN to be accessed on a read-only basis.

      • getReferenceReductionFactor

        double getReferenceReductionFactor()
        Gets the reduction factor for the reference TIN
        Returns:
        a positive value; the large the value the larger the reduction.

      • getTimeToLoadInMillis

        long getTimeToLoadInMillis()
        Gets the time required to load the model, in milliseconds. This value is used to format performance reports.
        Returns:
        a positive long integer.

      • getTimeToSortInMillis

        long getTimeToSortInMillis()
        Gets the time required to perform the post-loading Hilbert sort on the vertices, in milliseconds. This value is used to format performance reports.
        Returns:
        a positive long integer.

      • getPerimeterVertices

        List<org.tinfour.common.Vertex> getPerimeterVertices()
        Gets a list of the vertices that lie on the perimeter of the TIN. The perimeter should be a convex polygon.
        Returns:
        a list of vertices.

      • getLinearUnits

        org.tinfour.utils.LinearUnits getLinearUnits()
        Gets the linear units for the coordinate system used by the data. It is assumed that the vertical and horizontal coordinate systems will be in the same unit system, though assumption could change in a future implementation.
        Returns:
        a valid enumeration instance

      • isCoordinateSystemGeographic

        boolean isCoordinateSystemGeographic()
        Indicates whether the coordinates used by this instance are geographic in nature.
        Returns:
        true if coordinates are geographic; otherwise, false.

      • getVertexForIndex

        org.tinfour.common.Vertex getVertexForIndex(int index)
        Get the vertex with the specified vertex index.
        Parameters:
        index - an arbitrary integer.
        Returns:
        if matched, a valid vertex; otherwise, a null;

      • xy2geo

        void xy2geo(double x,
            double y,
            double[] geo)
        If defined, converts a pair of scaled Cartesian coordinates to a latitude and longitude. If undefined, no operation is performed.
        Parameters:
        x - a valid scaled Cartesian coordinate
        y - a valid scaled Cartesian coordinate
        geo - an array of dimension two to store the results (where geo[0]=latitude, geo[1]=longitude)

      • geo2xy

        void geo2xy(double latitude,
            double longitude,
            double[] xy)
        If defined, converts a pair of geographic (latitude,longitude) coordinates to a pair of scaled Cartesian coordinates. If undefined, no operation is performed.
        Parameters:
        latitude - the latitude
        longitude - the longitude
        xy - a array of dimension two to store the results.

      • hasConstraints

        boolean hasConstraints()
        Indicates whether the model has constraints and is thus a Constrained Delaunay Triangulation (CDT).
        Returns:
        true if the model has constraints.

      • addConstraints

        void addConstraints(File constraintsFile,
                    List<org.tinfour.common.IConstraint> constraints)
        Adds constraints to the model
        Parameters:
        constraintsFile - if the constraints were derived from a file, a valid reference; otherwise, a null
        constraints - a valid list of constraints.

      • getConstraints

        List<org.tinfour.common.IConstraint> getConstraints()
        Gets the current list of constraints for the model/
        Returns:
        a valid, potentially empty list.

      • hasVertexSource

        boolean hasVertexSource()
        Indicates that the model has a definition for a vertex source. At this time, all implementations define this value as true, though that is subject to change in the future. A model that has a vertex source might not yet have a valid list of vertices if the data from the source has not yet been loaded
        Returns:
        true if the model has a source of vertices; otherwise false.

      • areVerticesLoaded

        boolean areVerticesLoaded()
        Indicates if the vertex source for the model has been loaded
        Returns:
        true if the vertices for the model have been loaded; otherwise, false.

      • hasConstraintsSource

        boolean hasConstraintsSource()
        Indicates that the model has a definition for a constraint source. At this time, all implementations define this value as true, though that is subject to change in the future. A model that has a constraint source might not yet have a valid list of constraints if the data from the source has not yet been loaded
        Returns:
        true if the model has a source of vertices; otherwise false.

      • areConstraintsLoaded

        boolean areConstraintsLoaded()
        Indicates if the constraint source for the model has been loaded
        Returns:
        true if the vertices for the model have been loaded; otherwise, false.

      • getCoordinateTransform

        org.tinfour.utils.loaders.ICoordinateTransform getCoordinateTransform()
        Gets the coordinate transform associated with the model. If no transform is set, this method will return a null
        Returns:
        if set, a valid transform; otherwise, a null.
